intro: Thilachium, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its hardy nature, thriving in arid and coastal environments. Its woody structure and ability to withstand drought make it a resilient species. Thilachium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
